metadata.name: Dividing a Proper Fraction by a Whole Number
metadata.description: Learn to divide proper fractions by whole numbers using sharing and scaling methods.

objectives.description: Interpret division of a fraction by a whole number as equal sharing or scaling down.
Apply (a/b) √∑ n = (a/b) √ó (1/n) = a/(b¬∑n), then simplify the result.

prerequisites: Multiply a fraction by a unit fraction

canonicalPath.description: Interpret the problem as sharing equally among n parts
examples: If 3/4 of a cake is shared among 3 people, what does each person get?

canonicalPath.description: Convert division by n into multiplication by 1/n
Multiply numerators and denominators, then simplify

misconceptions.description: Only denominator changes when dividing by whole number
misconceptions.probe: What happens to the numerator when you multiply by 1/3?
misconceptions.hint: When we multiply 3/4 √ó 1/3, both numerator and denominator are affected: (3√ó1)/(4√ó3).

misconceptions.description: Thinking the result gets bigger when dividing
misconceptions.probe: If you share 3/4 of a pizza among 3 friends, does each person get more or less than 3/4?
misconceptions.hint: When we divide or share something, each part becomes smaller than the original.

states.prompt: Let's start with a real situation. If you have 3/4 of a pizza and want to share it equally among 3 friends, what fraction will each friend get? How would you figure this out?
